result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk:  Micki.

State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher for ADA Kerri Puig. Defendant appears in custody from MCJ w/Attorney Jessica Phelps. 
Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW.

COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed by ADA Kerri Puig within 30 days.

cc: Branch 3

Deft appears via video, in custody, pro se.

Review hearing on June 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

No contact with victim(s): A.O., D.O., J.O., R.O. or their residence, and Faith Ave in Weston, WI; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
